tcrudge.decorators module¶

tcrudge.decorators.perm_roles(items)¶

Check roles from input list.

tcrudge.handlers module¶

Module contains basic handlers.

class tcrudge.handlers.ApiHandler(application, request, **kwargs)¶

Bases: tcrudge.handlers.BaseHandler

Base helper class for API functions. model_cls MUST be defined.

exclude_fields = ()¶
get_schema_output¶

Maybe you’d ask: “What’s a get-schema?” The answer is that we wanted to check input of every request method in a homologous way. So we decided to describe any input and output using JSON schema.

max_depth = None¶
model_cls¶

Model class must be defined. Otherwise it’ll crash a little later even if nothing seems to be accessing a model class. If you think you don’t need a model class, consider the architecture. Maybe it doesn’t fit REST. In that case use BaseHandler. https://github.com/CodeTeam/tcrudge/issues/6

recurse = False¶
serialize(model)¶

Method to serialize a model. By default all fields are serialized by model_to_dict. The model can be any model you’ll pass through this method.

class tcrudge.handlers.ApiItemHandler(application, request, **kwargs)¶

Bases: tcrudge.handlers.ApiHandler

Base Item API Handler. Supports R, U, D from CRUDL.

delete(item_id)¶

Handle DELETE request. Model should define remove() method to handle delete logic. If method is not defined, HTTP 405 is raised.

delete_schema_input¶

JSON Schema to validate DELETE request body.

delete_schema_output¶
get(item_id)¶

Handle GET request. Returns serialized object.

get_item(item_id)¶

Fetch item from database by PK. Raises HTTP 404 if no item found.

get_schema_input¶

JSON Schema to validate DELETE request body.

put(item_id)¶

Handle PUT request. Validate data and update given item. Return HTTP 200 OK with result=’success’.

put_schema_input¶

JSON Schema to validate PUT request body.

put_schema_output¶
class tcrudge.handlers.ApiListHandler(*args, **kwargs)¶

Bases: tcrudge.handlers.ApiHandler

Base List API Handler. Supports C, L from CRUDL.

default_filter¶

Default queryset WHERE clause. Used for list queries first. :return: dict

default_limit = 50¶
default_order_by¶

Default queryset ORDER BY clause. Used for list queries first.

exclude_filter_args = ['limit', 'offset', 'total']¶
get()¶

Handle GET request. List items with given query parameters.

get_queryset(paginate=True)¶

Get queryset for model. Override this method to change logic.

get_schema_input¶

JSON Schema to validate GET Url parameters :return: dict

head()¶

Handle HEAD request. Fetch total amount of items and return them in header.

max_limit = 100¶
post()¶

Handle POST request. Validate data and create new item. Returns it’s id (PK).

post_schema_input¶

JSON Schema to validate POST request body. :return: dict

post_schema_output¶
prepare()¶

Method to get and validate offset and limit params for GET REST request.

class tcrudge.handlers.BaseHandler(application, request, **kwargs)¶

Bases: tornado.web.RequestHandler

Base helper class. Provides basic handy reponses.

To be used for customized handlers that don’t fit REST API recommendations.

Functions to handle different response formats must receive two arguments: - handler: subclass of tornado.web.RequestHandler; - answer: dictionary with response data.

bad_permissions()¶

Returns answer of access denied.

get_response(result=None, errors=None, **kwargs)¶

Method returns conventional formatted byte answer

get_roles()¶

Get roles.

is_auth()¶

Validate user authorized.

response(result=None, errors=None, **kwargs)¶

Method writes the response and finishes the request.

response_callbacks = {'application/json': <function response_json at 0x104e630d0>, 'application/x-msgpack': <function response_msgpack at 0x104e669d8>}¶
validate(data, schema)¶

Method to validate parameters Raises HTTPError(400) with error info for invalid data :param data: bytes or dict :param schema: dict, valid json schema

(http://json-schema.org/latest/json-schema-validation.html)
Returns:None if data is not valid. Else dict(data)
write_error(status_code, **kwargs)¶

Method gets traceback, writes it into response, finishes response.

tcrudge.response module¶

tcrudge.response.response_json(handler, answer)¶
tcrudge.response.response_msgpack(handler, answer)¶

Module contents¶

Simple async CRUDL framework based on Tornado and Peewee ORM
